_header: Saint Bridget the holy maid of Ireland was
Subjects: saints’ lives; Bridget, saint, life of
_description: Life of St. Bridget (longer version) in the South English Legendary — couplets

BodAsh43.First Lines:
SEyn Bride þe holi maide of hirlonde wasBiȝute heo was in
                    spouse bruche in awonder cas…
BodAsh43.Last Lines:
…þe uerst day of feuerer hire lif heo broȝte to
                    endeGod let ous alle for hir loue to þe Ioie of heuene
                    wende

Bod779.First Lines:
Seint bryde þe holy mayde of erlond ȝhe wasby ȝete
                    ȝhe was in spousbreche & in a wonder cas…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…at nouȝt so þat euer among sumþing þat mayde
                    let dyȝtSuþ hit by fal þer afterward þat þis mayde
                    cholde

BodLauMis463.First Lines:
SEint Bryde þe holy maide of yrlond wasbiȝeten in
                    spousebriche in a wonder cas…
BodLauMis463.Last Lines:
…Þe firste day of feuerer hire lyf heo brouȝt to
                    endeGod let us all forþ with hire to þe ioye of heuene
                    wende
BodLauMis463.Note: Two columns per page, one full-line, the other half-line.

BodTan17.First Lines:
SEint Bride þe holy maide of irlonde wasBe ȝete sche was
                    in spouse breke in a wonder cas…
BodTan17.Last Lines:
…þe firste dai of feuerer hir liif sche brouȝte to
                    endeGod lete us alle forþ wiþ hire to ioye of heuen
                    wende

                    was in spousebruche in a wonder cas…

OxfCCC431.Attributed Title:
De sancta brigida virgine & non martire (f.

CamCCC145.First Lines:
Sein bride þat holi maide of irlonde wasBi ȝute he was in
                    spousbruche in a wonder cas…
CamCCC145.Last Lines:
…Þe ferste day of feuerer hure lif he broȝte to
                    endeGod lete us alle forþ wiþ hure to þe ioie of heuene
                    wende

D’Evelyn,  Charlotte,  and  A. J. Mill, eds.

                British Museum MS. Cotton Julius D.ix.

Seint Bride þe holy mayde of yrlonde wasByȝute ȝeo
                    was in spousbruche in a wonder cas…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…Þe fferste day of ffeuerer hure lif ȝeo broȝte to
                    endeGod lete vs fforþ wiþ hure to þe ioye of heuene

CamTCC605.First Lines:
SEint bryde þe holy mayde of yrlond wasby ȝute heo was in
                    spouse bryche in a wounder cas…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…At last as god wold to þe deþ heo drowby for hure
                    deþ heo was ware þerof longe ynow

BLCottJulDIX.First Lines: SEinte Bride þat holimaide of yrlond wasBi ȝete ȝhe was in spousbreche in a wonþer cas…
BLCottJulDIX.Last Lines: …þe ferste dai of feuerer here lif ȝhe broȝte to endegod lete ous all for here loue to þe Ioie of heuene wenþe
BLCottJulDIX.Note: “Capitulum xi” added to left margin by later hand (f. 16v).

BLEge1993.Last Lines: …Þe furste day of feuerer hir lif heo brouȝte to endeGod lete vs alle wiþ hire to þe ioie of heuene wende

PROC473415.First Lines:
Seynt bride þe holy maide þat of irlonde wasByȝete
                    he was in spousbreche in a wonder casSuptak was hure fader name þat
                    ispoused hadde a wifIn luþer bileue of paynym hy ladde þo hare
                    lif…

NottsULMiLm7.First Lines:
…A seruant he hadde in is hous brocsech was hure nameÞis
                    duptac by soȝte hure of lechorie and ssameOn hure he byȝat a
                    child in spousbruche and wiþ wouÞo is owe wif hit vnder ȝet
                    sory he was ynou…
NottsULMiLm7.Last Lines:
…Þo bad þe quene vaste þat it moste [ ]
                    ybore…
NottsULMiLm7.Editions:
Historical Manuscripts Commission, Report on the Manuscripts of Lord
                Middleton, [formerly] preserved at Wollaton Hall, Nottinghamshire.
         (1911): 622-3.

TokyoTak54.First Lines:
Sent Bride þat holy maide Of Irelonde wasAnd was biȝete
                    in spousebreche in a wonder cas…
TokyoTak54.Last Lines:
…Þe ferst day of feuerȝere her lif she brouȝt to
                    endeGod sende vs grace as he did hur to þe Ioye of heuene wende.
                    Amen.
